title: EastEnders' Rita Simons wanted to leave soap but 'gutted' Roxy Mitchell killed off
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

EastEnders favourite Rita Simons admits she was ‘gutted’ to see the iconic Roxy Mitchell killed off the show.

Viewers were left devastated when Roxy and sister Ronnie (Samantha Womack) died on New Year’s Day, in 2017, in a haunting scene in a swimming pool.

And the 42-year-old has revealed she was devastated to be permanently leaving the BBC One soap, as she never wanted her character to die.

During an appearance on Good Morning Britain – to promote new play Everybody’s Talking About Jamie – she lifted the lid on her show exit.

‘Obviously it’s no secret we were gutted to leave, because we loved our characters,’ she told Susanna Reid and Adil Ray.

‘I love Sam, she’s my best friend, you become a pretend family.

Rita Simons was ‘gutted’ to leave EastEnders in 2017 (Picture: ITV)

‘We did want to leave but we didn’t want to die. And to watch your “sister” die, and to willingly kill your own character you’ve played for 10 years and you love, is a weird dilemma to be in, because you have to do the filming…’

Discussing her infamous death scene, Rita continued: ‘We laid in the pool for four hours with floats on our backs, there were divers arranging our dresses, and eventually that crane shot you saw came in and it just pans out.

‘We both watched it when it aired, it was one of the weirdest things I’ve ever seen.

‘What people don’t get is how much you invest yourself into the character you’re playing.’

Rita and Sam wanted to leave but didn’t want their characters to die (Picture: BBC)

However, there is one part of the show Rita still hangs onto dearly – her outfit from her very first scene.

If you cast your minds all the way back to 2007, Roxy made her entrance into the Queen Vic alongside Ronnie, on cousin Phil Mitchell’s wedding day to Stella.

She rocked a grey dress and white cowboy hat with a huge silver belt – the epitome of wedding guest fashion.

Rita still has Roxy’s cowboy hat (Picture: BBC)

And Rita confessed she took home the hat for the memories.

‘You look back on that and you’re like, “cringe, cringe”,’ she joked about her first scene.

‘I’ve still got it! When I left EastEnders, yes costume department, I nicked it and it’s in my loft!’

We would definitely hang it up, pride of place.
